Context:
Program Name: Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) Technician II
Code: T949
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Part-time
Duration: 32 weeks (approximately)
Starting Months: Open enrolment
Domestic Tuition: $1,700.00*
Location: Online
Program Description: An advanced study of Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) in manufacturing, including Distributed Control Systems (DCS), Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition systems (SCADA).
Advanced Standing: Students who have finished the PLC Technician program will receive credit for exemptions from 7 modules of the PLC Technician II program.
Note: This online distance program does not qualify for study/work permit eligibility in Canada for international students.

Context:
This distance education certificate program offers training in PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), specifically DCS (Distributed Control Systems) and SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition Systems). The program utilizes the simulator PLCLogix 5000 and Studio 5000/Rockwell RSLogix 5000 software for comprehensive coverage of tag-based PLC programming. The simulation software includes over 250 pre-built lab projects and 10 manufacturing environments.

The program is open for enrolment at any time, with no set completion time and flexible pacing. Students will use an interactive learning package to complete modules containing text, audio, 2D and 3D animations, computer-based testing, and PLCLogix 5000 simulation software. Each module is accompanied by a final exam taken online (computer-based testing).

Prerequisites include an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, or mature student status. Minimum computer requirements are an Intel Core i3, i5, i7, AMD Ryzen 3, 5, 7 processor or equivalent, 4GB RAM, 500MB of available disk space, Windows 7/8/8.1/10/11 operating system, and internet access with an email account.

The typical completion time for the program is 32 weeks, but there are no set time limits. If students have minimal or no background in PLCs, they are recommended to begin with the foundation PLC Technician program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) Technician II Program (Distance Education) T949 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text describes a certificate program offered by the college in the field of industrial automation and control. The program is designed for Windows Operating Systems and prepares students to work as PLC technicians, installing and repairing industrial electronic equipment and writing PLC programs for various automated control systems.

Required courses for the program include:
- ELNC 9127: Introduction to Advanced PLCs
- ELNC 9094: PLC Processors
- ELNC 9073: I/O System
- ELNC 9074: Programming Terminals and Peripherals
- ELNC 9075: Installation and Maintenance of PLCs
- ELNC 9124: Tag-Based PLCs
- ELNC 9095: Ladder Logic Programming
- ELNC 9078: Timers
- ELNC 9079: Counters
- ELNC 9096: Branch and Loop Control
- ELNC 9081: Sequencers
- ELNC 9097: Data Handling
- ELNC 9098: Math Instructions
- ELNC 9084: Process Control
- ELNC 9099: PLC Communication
- ELNC 9118: Distributed Control System (DCS)
- ELNC 9119: SCADA System
- ELNC 9093: Advanced Programming Languages
- ELNC 9092: Robotics

The tuition for domestic students is $1,700. The program does not qualify for study/work permit eligibility in Canada for international students and there is no additional cost.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) Technician II Program (Distance Education) T949 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The George Brown College offers a PLC Technician II program as an online distance education. The total tuition for the program starting in Fall 2023 is $4,570 ($440 for initial registration + $70 x 18 modules). International students are charged the same fees but in U.S. dollars and the exchange rate at the time of registration will be used to determine the final fee in Canadian dollars. This program does not qualify for OSAP funding and is not eligible for study/work permit eligibility in Canada, meaning international students must study while remaining in their home country.

Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent or mature student status to apply. Previous practical PLC experience is helpful but not essential. For more information and to apply, contact the college at 416-415-4726 or toll-free at 1-888-553-5333 or email [info@gbctechtraining.com](mailto:info@gbctechtraining.com). Check out the course details and interactive video tour on plctechnician.com. Related programs include Electromechanical Engineering Technician (T146) and Robotics Technician (Distance Education) (T ).

Please note that fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates, and the information contained on the website is subject to change without notice.
